title: Custom fragment
body: Would be nice if could add the custom_fragement to the directories hash. As long as nested templates don't work I think this is the only way to go.

title: Auth
body:
I would love to discuss these changes with you.

The template for the directories contains more general directives/template parameters which allow you to use basic auth as well as digest auth. Somehow this pull requests reverts the latests changes on this topic.

I also tried to add syntax highlighting to the README and added documentation about the auth directives.

Best Regards
Philipp

title: Update apache::params for Amazon Linux
body:
Amazon Linux AMI is a lot like RedHat 6 but has an
`$operatingsystemrelease` value of `3.4.37-40.44.amzn1.x86_64`
currently which throws off the `$distrelease` in the params class.

Adding these defaults should fix this issue.

Closes #285

title: Add `httpd_dir` parameter to the base class for custom builds
body: Closes #265

title: Update spec tests to use serverspec instead of YAML
body: Oh, and add some specs for the default mods.

title: Allow overriding the passenger package
body:
In some cases, it might be needed to override the passenger package name. For
example, Foreman uses SCL to provide ruby 1.9.3 on RHEL 6.

title: Add KeepAlive parameter
body:
KeepAlive parameter was added to init.pp (by default is equal apache::params::keepalive), params.pp (by default is 'Off') and template httpd.conf.erb
Desription was added to README.md

title: (#278) Ports file attempted to be created before Apache installed
body:
Ports file creation should depend on Apache being installed.

Closes #278

title: Add KeepAlive parameter
body:
KeepAlive parameter was added to init.pp (by default is equal apache::params::keepalive), params.pp (by default is 'Off') and template httpd.conf.erb
Desription was added to README.md

title: Add KeepAlive variable
body:
keepalive variable was added to params.pp (for all OS is equal 'Off'), init.pp (is equal apache::params::keepalive) and to httpd.conf.erb template.
Also description of it was added to README.md.

title: Remove sendfile comment
body:
The comment in the conditional block for sendfile directive inclusion caused the plain text directive name to not be included in the resulting conf file.

Example with $sendfile set to `'Off'`:

    ...
    LogLevel warn
    Off
    ...

Example without comment:

    ...
    LogLevel warn
    
    EnableSendfile Off
    ....

title: (#272) Add parameter sslproxyengine to vhost.pp
body:
In order to use mod_proxy with remote servers using the SSL/TLS protocol it is
needed to activate the SSL/TLS Protocol Engine for proxy. Setting this
parameter to true adds the directive `SSLProxyEngine on` to the virtual host.

title: Release 0.8.1
body:
Bugfixes:
- Update `apache::mpm_module` detection for worker/prefork
- Update `apache::mod::cgi` and `apache::mod::cgid` detection for worker/prefork

title: Use a more specific match for changing worker/prefork
body:
Adds tests to and closes #258

Also corrects cgid/cgi mod behaviour discovered during testing.

title: default_mods overreaches by implementing much more than stock OS defaults
body:
For instance: while the mod_disk_cache module does get loaded on a stock redhat-family apache install, it's actually not enabled; the config is commented out in the httpd.conf provided by the httpd rpm.

However, the apache::mod::disk_cache class both loads the module *and* turns it on. This would undoubtedly cause some unexpected behavior for a number of sites, especially considering $apache::default_mods defaults to true. If the goal of apache::default_mods is to try and mimic a default setup for each OS flavor, then this mod should be removed from this class.

This is also true for a number of other apache mods. Fortunately, since all of the ones that should be removed are already classes, this means it will be trivial for others to selectively include them in their own modules.

title: Use a more specific match for changing to worker
body:
httpd from centos.alt.ru has both #HTTPD=/usr/sbin/httpd.worker and #HTTPD=/usr/sbin/httpd.itk
in the default file, so the shorter match gets confused

title: Add KeepAlive parameter
body: Default is Off

title: Release 0.8.0
body:
Features:
- Add `servername` parameter to `apache` class
- Add `proxy_set` parameter to `apache::balancer` define

Bugfixes:
- Fix ordering for multiple `apache::balancer` clusters
- Fix symlinking for sites-available on Debian-based OSs
- Fix dependency ordering for recursive confdir management
- Fix `apache::mod::*` to notify the service on config change
- Documentation updates

title: make directories examples real puppet DSL
body:
People don't read:

    directory => [ { path => '/path/to/directory', <directive> => <value> } ],

as psuedo-code example instructing you on how to form an array of hashes, they
read them as puppet DSL examples that they can copy and paste into their
apache::vhost stanzas.

title: Add severname parameter to httpd.conf
body: closes #242

title: Issue 230 specifiy that: The apache::mod::* classes that have .conf file
body:
resources don't refresh the service when the configs are updated, but they
should. (https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/issues/230).

This commit fixes the issue by adding:

        notify  => Service['httpd'],

to all file resources.

Note that the modification has only been tested with a few of the modules.

title: make fragment names unique to support multiple balancerclusters
Release 0.7.0
body:
Changes:
- Essentially rewrite the module -- too many to list
- `apache::vhost` has many abilities -- see README.md for details
- `apache::mod::*` classes provide httpd mod-loading capabilities
- `apache` base class is much more configurable

Bugfixes:
- Many. And many more to come

title: Update travis file for automatic github release
Added an 'h' in a typo on default_ssl_vost
body: Inside the module paragraph of apache::mod::ssl  a typo was made (i think) in the ```default_ssl_vost```   should be  ```default_ssl_vhost```

title: Add ServerName = @fqdn to httpd.conf
body:
On some nodes, we were seeing this warning: (thanks @gchaix)

```# service httpd restart
Stopping httpd:                                            [  OK  ]
Starting httpd: httpd: Could not reliably determine the server's fully qualified domain name, using 2001:4801:7817:72:f156:fa90:ff10:3a72 for ServerName [  OK  ]```

We fixed it by adding ServerName = fqdn in the httpd.conf.erb.

In a similar vein to #82 and #175. Hopefully mine passes Travis.
